body: There's support for version options in Picocli: https://picocli.info/#_version_help

Looks very good to me!

`java -jar junit-platform-console-standalone-1.11.0-20240516.144734-223.jar --version`
```
JUnit Platform Console Launcher 1.11.0-SNAPSHOT
JVM: 23-ea (Oracle Corporation OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 23-ea+21-1723)
OS: Windows 11 10.0 amd64
```

However, running `junit` on the module path does not look so good to me.

`org.junit.platform.console/junit@1.11.0-M2 --version`
```
JUnit Platform Console Launcher null
JVM: 22.0.1 (Oracle Corporation OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 22.0.1+8-16)
OS: Windows 11 10.0 amd64
```

This
https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/f82aefa44fc60e7e6e76adca7cabba093ff401d9/junit-platform-console/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/console/options/ManifestVersionProvider.java#L18
returns `null`.

We should fist try a `ModuleVersionProvider` on Java 9+, like we do here:
https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/f82aefa44fc60e7e6e76adca7cabba093ff401d9/junit-platform-engine/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/engine/TestEngine.java#L184-L195
And resort to a non-null fallback value.
@sormuras, can you please create a new issue to address that in 5.11 M3?

issue.title: Version reported as `null` on module path

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Running `junit --version` on the module path emits `null` instead of the version string.

`org.junit.platform.console/junit@1.11.0-M2 --version`
```
JUnit Platform Console Launcher null
JVM: 22.0.1 (Oracle Corporation OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 22.0.1+8-16)
OS: Windows 11 10.0 amd64
```

This
https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/f82aefa44fc60e7e6e76adca7cabba093ff401d9/junit-platform-console/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/console/options/ManifestVersionProvider.java#L18
returns `null`.

We should first try a `ModuleVersionProvider` on Java 9+, like we do here:
https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/f82aefa44fc60e7e6e76adca7cabba093ff401d9/junit-platform-engine/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/engine/TestEngine.java#L184-L195
And resort to a non-null fallback value.

_Originally posted by @sormuras in https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/3795#issuecomment-2122584604_
